intro: Xanthoxalis corniculata var. aureoflava, commonly known as the golden buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
